oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Development of a Veterinary Formulary
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kinsell, Richard
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: formulary
medication
pharmacology
treatment regimes
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: As Veterinary Pharmacists who are involved primarily in teaching institutions, we have perhaps a greater responsibility to provide students and staff with some concise, accurate source of information on medication than our colleagues in service positions. There is an abundance of excellent texts available which discuss the rationale of pharmacology, diagnoses, treatment regimes and other related topics. These texts all serve an essential function in the education of the veterinary student body. However, when we look at the situation that evolves for the veterinary student in the junior and senior year, we find once they are faced with the situation of "hands-on" use of medication, that there then may come about a slightly different picture.
